page.title: 16Education - Silloth
page.content: There are 2 schools -{Silloth Primary &{Solway Community School}(secondary). The old{ infants school }was built in Victorian style and the {junior school was temporary buildings from about 1950 and 3 purpose-built classrooms. The present {Primary School }was built in 1980 to replace the old buildings of the separate infants and junior schools. The Head is{Mr.P.Billingsley who has 9 full-time and 1 part-time staff, with{245 pupils. }The school is partly open plan and partly separate rooms linked by movable partitions. Lessons include English,Maths,History, Sciences,Geography,Religion,Music and P.E. Their organised games consist of rounders, cricket, longball, football, netball and athletics. They have many school visits _more than 12 this year. There are 3 breaks each day, including the lunch break. {Cont'd.
